Procurement Team Lead Job at Eko Maintenance Limited




        
    

        
        Eko Maintenance Limited is a rapidly growing Facility Management Company that specializes in maintenance of high-rise building facilities with an office located in Victoria Island, Lagos.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Team Lead
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are looking for a Procurement Team Lead to oversee and manage our procurement operation, ensuring the acquisition of goods and services while maintaining strong vendor relationships.
	The Ideal candidate should be a strategic thinker with excellent leadership skills and deep understanding of Supply chain Management, developing procurement strategies, negotiating contracts and ensure compliance with company policies and industry regulations.


Responsibilities


	Team Leadership: Guide, manage, and mentor the procurement team, fostering a positive and collaborative environment.
	Strategy Development: Develop and implement innovative procurement strategies aligned with company objectives and cost-saving goals.
	Supplier Management: Source, evaluate, and select suppliers, negotiate contracts to secure favourable terms, and maintain strong, long-term vendor relationships.
	Process Management: Oversee the end-to-end procurement process, including requisitions, purchasing, receiving, and invoicing.
	Cost Control: Monitor budgets, analyse procurement expenditures, identify cost-saving opportunities, and track key performance indicators (KPIs).
	Compliance: Ensure all procurement activities comply with company policies, relevant laws, and regulatory requirements.
	Collaboration: Work closely with internal departments to understand their procurement needs and ensure timely delivery of goods and services.
	Performance Improvement: Monitor supplier and team performance, identify areas for process improvement, and implement solutions to enhance efficiency and productivity.
	Reporting: Prepare and present reports on procurement activities, expenditures, and cost savings to management.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s and Masters degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or related field
	5 + years of experience in procurement or supply chain management
	2 + years of experience in a leadership or supervisory role
	Experience in Purchasing construction and mechanical tool is an added advantage.
	Strong negotiation and contract management skills
	Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities
	Proficiency in procurement software and Microsoft Office Suites
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
	Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines
	Knowledge of Procurement regulations and compliance standards
	Experience with supplier relationship management.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidate should send their CV to: recruitment2@ekomaintenance.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Warehouse / Store Officer Job at Nemitt Pharmaceuticals Limited




        
    

        
        The company Nemitt Pharmaceuticals Limited is an indigenous pharmaceutical company incorporated in July 1988 as a fully capitalized limited liability company with RC no 116 088 to among other activities, engage in the wholesale of Pharmaceutical products. Nemitt Pharmaceuticals Limited was born out of the dire need for an alternative to the hitherto existing chaotic distribution in the pharmaceutical supply chain. with the goal of addressing the gaps in the distribution value chain.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse / Store Officer

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	A Pharmaceutical wholesale distributor is looking for men who are passionate about the workings of a Warehouse to join in our team as Store Officers.
	They will be responsible for receiving materials incoming from vendors, managing warehouse/ store stock, replenishing shop floor stock, and maintaining accurate stock records.


Responsibilities


	Maintain and monitor the accuracy of inventory and timely replenishment.
	Ensure all documentation related to responsibility is accurately processed, distributed, and released to all concerned in a timely manner.
	Ensures all responsibilities are complied with any company policy, systems, and industry.
	Makes sure stock is arranged for easy physical count and stock-taking
	Replenish shop floor stock constantly
	Managed inbound and outbound process of product.
	Ensure the relevance and accuracy of all documentation relating to goods received and goods dispatched including labeling of all stock items
	Ensure that workings are in compliance with standards and policy
	Issues materials against authorized store requisition and keeps store.
	Report all warehouse activities on monthly for stock inventory, and pallets kept at warehouses both internal and external.
	To ensure physical stock takes correct in compared to the system and give an explanation for variances


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an ND or HND with 2 years of experience.
	Age range: 24- 38 years old.
	Warehouse or retail store experience would be advantageous
	High level of Integrity.
	Physical strength to carry and move stock
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to pay attention to detail.
	Proximity to Surulere, Ojuelegba, and Yaba would be most preferred.
	Must live within or close to Surulere, Ojuelegba, Ajegunle, Apapa, Mushin, Fadeyi, Yaba or environ.


Salary
N100,000 - N140,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Hrnemitt@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
